title: Diagnostic Reasoning with Generative AI
pi: Majid Afshar, Matthew Churpek, Anoop Mayampurath
description: Use pre-trained language models and knowledge graphs to support clinical diagnostic decision-making and build clinical NLP benchmarks.

title: Generative Modeling of Cells
description: Use generative models to simulate unseen microscopy experiments, guiding experimental design with computational inference.

title: Metadata Standardization for Machine Learning
pi: Colin Dewey, Mark Craven, Junjie Hu
description: Develop NLP and active learning methods to automatically standardize metadata from large heterogeneous datasets like SRA.

title: Single-Cell and Spatial Analysis of Inflammation
description: Analyze cross-species scRNA-seq and spatial omics data to study immune responses in burns and early cancer development.

title: Genomics and Gene Regulation in Alzheimerâ€™s Disease
description: Explore blood methylation markers, co-expression networks, and QTL analysis using statistical and ML methods.

title: Statistical Methods for Gene-Environment Interactions
description: Develop statistical frameworks for detecting gene-environment and gene-gene interactions in complex traits.

title: ML for Immunotherapy and Precision Medicine
description: Apply machine learning to immunotherapy, electronic health records, genomics, and microbiome data using explainable ML and visualization tools.

title: Gene Regulatory Networks and Multi-Omics Integration
description: Develop matrix factorization, autoencoders, and graph learning to study gene regulation and 3D genome organization.

title: Language Models for Brain Disorder Complexity
description: Use transformer-based models to analyze single-cell data across brain disorders and integrate multi-modal data.

title: Meta-analysis of Diagnostic and Tumor Data
description: Develop statistical methods for meta-analysis with missing data and for analyzing nonlinear tumor growth curves in preclinical studies.
